referenced_message.content:
Hi all, a couple updates from Bob, Jon and myself after our meeting:
1 - Repair and activity fixes are in progress.
2 - Regarding marketing: the three of us have an incredible vision regarding the tech and development of the collection.  However, as this community has pointed out, that vision lacks in marketing and community building.  We are officially putting out an RFP (request for proposal) for anyone in the Sentinels community regarding creation and execution of a marketing plan and/or a community management/expansion plan.  Everyone is invited to submit a proposal to the community.  The community will decide which proposal(s) move forwards.  More info to follow.
3 - For Sentinels, there may be additional needs for paid roles outside of community-building and marketing, it's tbd, as discussions are still early.  But to give a taste of what I am thinking, there may be an opportunity for an AI component in the collection and that may require another RFP (so don't spend all the mint on marketing üôÇ ).
4 - Bob and I have met with some journalists interested in the Sentinels story.  Possible to start seeing some press coverage as early as Monday.
5 - There's additional promotions planned with other ICP apps, most notably DSCVR, but discussions/planning are still ongoing, so no commitments at this time.
6 - Regarding the 41 unaccounted airdrop Sentinels, Bob will provide an accurate account.  Mostly the error lied in us failing to account for changes in a spreadsheet.  All Sentinels are accounted for though...
7 - Finally, the three of us want to remind the community that we are committed to decentralizing this project.  Phase 2 of the game is intended to take another step in that direction.  Ultimately, Sentinels should be fully-decentralized, and we'd like to make that process both fun and fair in order to set a precedent in the industry.

We are officially putting out an RFP (request for proposal) for anyone in the Sentinels community regarding creation and execution of a marketing plan and/or a community management/expansion plan.  Everyone is invited to submit a proposal to the community.  The community will decide which proposal(s) move forwards.  More info to follow.

6 - Regarding the 41 unaccounted airdrop Sentinels, Bob will provide an accurate account.  Mostly the error lied in us failing to account for changes in a spreadsheet.  All Sentinels are accounted for though...

referenced_message.content:
Hi all, a couple updates from Bob, Jon and myself after our meeting:
1 - Repair and activity fixes are in progress.
2 - Regarding marketing: the three of us have an incredible vision regarding the tech and development of the collection.  However, as this community has pointed out, that vision lacks in marketing and community building.  We are officially putting out an RFP (request for proposal) for anyone in the Sentinels community regarding creation and execution of a marketing plan and/or a community management/expansion plan.  Everyone is invited to submit a proposal to the community.  The community will decide which proposal(s) move forwards.  More info to follow.
3 - For Sentinels, there may be additional needs for paid roles outside of community-building and marketing, it's tbd, as discussions are still early.  But to give a taste of what I am thinking, there may be an opportunity for an AI component in the collection and that may require another RFP (so don't spend all the mint on marketing üôÇ ).
4 - Bob and I have met with some journalists interested in the Sentinels story.  Possible to start seeing some press coverage as early as Monday.
5 - There's additional promotions planned with other ICP apps, most notably DSCVR, but discussions/planning are still ongoing, so no commitments at this time.
6 - Regarding the 41 unaccounted airdrop Sentinels, Bob will provide an accurate account.  Mostly the error lied in us failing to account for changes in a spreadsheet.  All Sentinels are accounted for though...
7 - Finally, the three of us want to remind the community that we are committed to decentralizing this project.  Phase 2 of the game is intended to take another step in that direction.  Ultimately, Sentinels should be fully-decentralized, and we'd like to make that process both fun and fair in order to set a precedent in the industry.

content: Look at how many buyers there are on Solana, with volumes lower than Bitcoin. This indirectly indicates that people on Solana are selling the majority of NFTs for pennies. There's a culture of disdain for NFT there.
DSCVR will soon integrate Bitcoin. Better to fully focus on bringing people from the Bitcoin ecosystem through this social network.

1. The fact that Solana periodically goes on vacation is laughed at by everyone, regardless of belonging to any blockchain :)

Personally, I don't understand the desire to attract users from Solana to the NFT environment of the ICP ecosystem. For most people on Solana, NFTs are a worthless asset for instant sale once minted. Because of this, they are disliked in the Ordinals ecosystem, for example.

2 & 3. In the time since Solana was integrated into DSCVR, if I'm not mistaken, not a single collection that was distributed via Lootboxes has gone popular. In fact, the Lootboxes have become a mailing list of promotional flyers from various portals.
If Bioniq is going to create and distribute a collection via Lootboxes, it's vital that the collection be liquid and give Solana users a chance to earn money (that's all they need).

5. That's a good suggestion. But I hope that someday Rick and his team will create their own nft marketplace. I've been asking them to for years now :)

Personally, looking at how Solana users have behaved on the Bitcoin blockchain, I think the best strategy is to drop a few Bioniq collections to users of portals dedicated to Solana. Then drop a couple collections to holders of Solana's top collections. Then it's imperative to make sure these collections are liquid so that Solana users can make a profit. Then it is necessary to organize several sales with a white list for Solana users and also to provide at least a small but profit (at least x2). After that we should see if their predatory gaze will turn to Bioniq as a means of possible earnings :)

And I'll say it again - in the nft ecosystems of various blockchains, users from Solana are not liked. Sometimes they literally kill collections, selling at a loss if the collection did not immediately show a good price at the start of sales. I don't understand the targeting of these people.

referenced_message.content:
1. It's crucial for the ICP Community to shift its focus from attacking SOL to fostering a collaborative environment. This approach is not only more productive but also aligns with ICP's inclusive nature, which is designed to support all networks. (9 out of 10 Difficulty) 

2. DSCVR Loot Boxes are SOL Compressed NFTs. These become immediately listed on Magic Eden. Which can be bought on DSCVR through embedded profile links.

3. Design a series of Artworks that tie back to a DSCVR Portal and can help influence Reserve Ordinals. I previously mentioned this to you for the ckBTC Portal. You can try to get something on the Magic Eden Launchpad with an incentive to join the DSCVR Portal.

4. DSCVR added DSCVR Frame ckBTC Giveaway -> if you are looking to give out ckBTC this is a great option. However, this isn't effective for maintaining retention.

5. Get Bioniq to integrate the ckBTC Market with DSCVR so people can trade directly from DSCVR. DSCVR has already done this with Magic Eden for SOL NFTs; I'm curious to see if it works with Ordinals for Embedding. (This makes buying more fluid, with fewer links‚Äîthink one-click buy instead of redirects.) It would also need Bioniq Wallet integration. (This would be time-consuming, but 100% worth the time)

content: typically the platform does not require as much communication but in the case with bioniq you are asking people to use what they perceive as a wrapped btc on a platform that uses web 2 logins.  As well as the platform has the need for trust assumptions since the platform is custodial in the sense they host the wrapped ordinals in a canister that the dev team has the keys to. For it to gain adoption the people using it need to feel they can trust the team to communicate at all times.

Really the only collection that has volume and or a decent floor is the sentinels so yes they should play a role in it.

The swop and Dscvr team are probably the best people to ask about promotion ideas since they are active in the sol community. They have a much different culture than the community here. 

And I would suggest before running any promo to sol,eth,and or btc communities the team for the sentinels and bioniq improve the flow of communication exponentially. The nft culture over on those chains require basic transparency and communication from the platform and teams. 

Currently we do not get any information on bioniq updates and or what is going on with our sentinels. If we are to attract people this flow of communication must be improved.

A quick recap of talking points for the Sentinels:
- this is a first-of-kind gamified ordinal collection
- it also will be a first-of-kind ordinal + runes collection (with BRC-20 also on the roadmap)
- trading and playing the ordinal is cheap and fast (10 sats), even in a high bitcoin-fee environment
- the 3D animation resulted in huge asset sizes (~100kb/image), but Bioniq's BitGen standard will keep inscription costs down to about the cost of a btc transaction
- the artwork is phenomenal and continues one of the most iconic franchises in ICP
- Bioniq is the only ordinal L2 in existence.  We can solve high btc fees by moving some or all ordinal and rune activity to Bioniq

Once holders start to inscribe their level 4 sentinels, the resulting ordinal will without a doubt be one of the highest quality ordinal in existence (I don't know of any other 3D animated collections).  #CanYourOrdinalLookThisGood?

Tens of thousands of people in the bitcoin ecosystem, recently minted tokens at fees over $100 per transaction. They have no problem buying NFTs, paying an average of 30-50 dollars per transaction. It doesn't stress them out too much.

Further... All of their favorite collections are on ME. Every day, for a year, there were first collections launched on the bitcoin blockchain in something, but the vast majority of them are now unclaimed :) Motoko is only meaningful for us / ICP ecosystem, but not for them. People could be attracted by moving some of the collections from ME, but apparently nothing like that was in the plans from the beginning.

Apart from the points mentioned above, is there any other strategy to attract people from the bitcoin ecosystem? All of the above has already failed to work.

Maybe we should aggressively intercept new promising collections on bitcoin and financially incentivize their creators to launch projects initially on Bioniq?

So the reserved ordinal and or the wrapped inscription is not held in a canister that the devs have the keys to?

referenced_message.content: It is non-custodial. You inscribe in place by default to a wrapper address that only you control. The token you hold is the only token that can sign for that wrapper address. After inscribing, you can send it out to wherever you want whenever you want. You essentially prove ownership of the token, send to the canister, and then a tECDSA signature is done to transfer your ordinal to your externally provided address.

content: It is non-custodial. You inscribe in place by default to a wrapper address that only you control. The token you hold is the only token that can sign for that wrapper address. You essentially prove ownership of the token, send to the canister, and then a tECDSA signature is done to transfer your ordinal to your externally provided address.

referenced_message.content:
You can inscribe to Bitcoin and keep your asset on Bioniq. By default, when you inscribe, you inscribe to a wrapper address on ICP and automatically wrap your Ordinal back to Bioniq. Your token doesn't really even change at all, except now you have a viable Bitcoin inscription tied to your ordinal.

So I view inscribing as 'backing up your token to Bitcoin' more than forcing you to move over to Bitcoin immediately.

Ghosts, according to folklore and popular culture, are believed to be the spirits or souls of deceased people who continue to exist in some form after death. What ghosts do varies depending on cultural beliefs and individual interpretations. Some common beliefs about ghosts include:

Haunting: Ghosts are often associated with haunted locations, where they may linger due to unfinished business, a strong emotional attachment to a place, or a traumatic event that occurred there.
Manifestations: Ghosts are said to sometimes manifest themselves to the living through visual apparitions, auditory phenomena (such as footsteps or voices), or by affecting the environment (such as moving objects or changes in temperature).
Communication: Some people believe that ghosts may attempt to communicate with the living through various means, such as EVP (Electronic Voice Phenomena), ouija boards, or dreams.
Residual Energy: In some beliefs, ghosts are not conscious entities but rather residual energy left behind by past events, replaying like a recording under certain conditions.
Guidance or Protection: In certain cultures, ancestors or guardian spirits are believed to watch over and protect their descendants or loved ones.
Of course, beliefs about ghosts vary widely across different cultures and individuals, ranging from traditional spiritual beliefs to skepticism rooted in scientific inquiry. Ultimately, what ghosts do is a matter of personal belief and interpretation.

referenced_message.content:
**Just got off a call with Kyle and Jon. Here is the call summary (for extra transparency):**

1. Drop repair costs from 500 sats -> 100 sats (we're here to ensure people have ckBTC to transact, not to punish whales that have to upgrade dozens and dozens of Motokos).

2. Glitch will be randomly distributed as airdrop to a lucky Motoko Sentinel holder (as discussed previously here, works best)

3. A portion of revenue from the launch will go to cover Bioniq launch fee, Bioniq custom dev, Jon's artwork, and inscription fees on Bitcoin. The rest will go to treasury. Still finalizing percentages here.

4. Motokos are separate from the Poked Bot ecosystem. There can be cross-overs, but they are clearly distinct communities (for legal reasons as well as separation of concerns reasons). So we'll leep the lore separate between Motokos and Poked Bots to keep distance between the two collections.

5. It may be helpful to add a setting for users to add a parenthetical price in ICP instead of dollars for the ICP users in the community that prefer accounting in ICP (rather than ckBTC or $$).

6. Simplify the process of onboarding from ICP -> ckBTC. Still painful to swap. Consider building in swapping functionality (and holding ICP) directly into Bioniq.

7. We need to get listed on Crypto Slam (or other NFT tracking services). Anyone have any connections here? Let's get Motokos on the cross-chain map.

8. Update on PR article. They want it a bit sexier. So we're spicing it up with data/future plans. A few more rounds of review before they start pitching to NFT outlets.

9. This project only succeeds with community support. How can we effectively include people in building the Motoko lore, contributing to game mechanics, etc.?

10. Some people have had bad luck with their Motokos on missions. Others have had crazy success. Maybe we have a leaderboard showing best Motoko of the week (best luck on missions) and worst motoko of the week (worst luck on missions).
